thread.title: 10 Items Every 20-Something Should Have in Their Apartment - Vogue
thread.title_full: 10 Items Every 20-Something Should Have in Their Apartment - Vogue

title: 10 Items Every 20-Something Should Have in Their Apartment - Vogue
text: The 10 Things Every 20-Something Should Have in Their Apartment December 8, 2015 10:11 AM by Brooke Bobb Moving out of a dorm room is a rite of passage. It’s also huge relief: Gone are the days of a tiny twin bed, pictures Scotch-taped to the walls, bathroom caddies, and wrinkled clothes smashed into a high school locker–sized closet. A 20-something’s first apartment is a whole new ball game in terms of decorating, and some major thought is required when making a list of furniture to fill it with. Avoid the dorm part deux trap and instead work to cultivate your personal interior aesthetic. Here, the 10 most essential pieces to invest in for your first “grown-up” place. 1 / 10 A Grown-Up Bed You no longer have to be confined to the tiny twin mattress, so it’s time to choose a sleeping arrangement fit for a working person (and someone who will undoubtedly be in need of a better night’s sleep than in the hard-partying college years). A queen-size bed is the best upgrade, and a proper headboard is a quick way to make a bedroom feel polished. Photo: Courtesy of West Elm Vogue may earn compensation on these sales through affiliate programs. In This Story: Interior Design Recommended For You
